Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is a variable?
At the main function: A location in memory that can store a value

Where do C programs begin to execute?: Where are variables declared in a C program?
At the main function: Variables can be declared anywhere in a program. They can be declared inside a function (local variables) or outside the functions (global variables)

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the main difference between a while and a do...while statement?
At the main function: The block inside a do...while statement will execute at least once.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is typically included in a class definition?
At the main function: Data members (attributes) and member functions.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function?
At the main function: Data members can be accessed from any member functions inside the class definition. Local variables can only be accessed inside the member function that defines them.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition?
At the main function: A function prototype includes the function signature, i.e., the name of the function, the return type, and the parameters' type. The function definition includes the actual body of the function.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the role of a header-file?
At the main function: To store a class interface, including data members and member function prototypes.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What does a function signature include?
At the main function: The name of the function and the types of the parameters.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the scope of global variables?
At the main function: File scope.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: How does the compiler handle inline functions?
At the main function: It makes a copy of the function code in every place where a function call is made.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the role of a prototype program in problem solving?
At the main function: To simulate the behaviour of portions of the desired software product.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What are the elements typically included in a class definition?
At the main function: Function members and data members.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is a function signature?
At the main function: A function that calls itself.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: Is ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException a run-time error or a compilation error?
At the main function: Run-time error.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is scope of a variable?
At the main function: Scope of a variable is the part of the program where the variable may directly be accessible. In C, all identifiers are lexically (or statically) scoped.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is a static function?
At the main function: A function in which acccess to it is restricted to the file where they are declared.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the difference between i++ and ++i?
At the main function: The expression i++ returns the old value and then increments i. The expression ++i increments the value and returns new value.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is the difference between including the header file within angular braces < > and double quotes ” “?
At the main function: Header file in angular braces is searched only within the built-in include path. Header file in double quotes is searched in the working directory first, then the built-in include path.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is a data structure?
At the main function: A data structure is a particular way of organizing data in a computer so that it can be used effectively.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is dynamic data structure?
At the main function: Dynamic data structure is an organization or collection of data in a memory that grows and shrinks as needed by allocating and deallocating memory from heap.

Where do C programs begin to execute?: What is static data structure?
At the main function: Static data structures isare an organization or collection of data in memory that is fixed in size.
